settings.question_answer:
Vitamin C is a powerful antioxidant that plays a role in immune health, albeit one that has become overinflated. People extremely deficient in vitamin C - and this is rare - can develop scurvy, a deficiency disease.

Vitamin C is naturally found in fruits and vegetables, like oranges, broccoli, and tomatoes, and the best way to get it is to consume these foods raw. If you’re not getting a lot of these foods in your diet, you may be getting less than the daily recommended amount.
